data.prayer: Spirit, make the church in Narail, Khulna, Bangladesh humble and willing to hear the sometimes hard voices of prophets bringing the light of truth on them.
data.verse: So have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Narail, Khulna, Bangladesh
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Jesus, help the local leaders in Narail, Khulna, Bangladesh to be faithful with what they have been given, whether a little or a lot.
data.verse: Everyone to whom much was given, of him much will be required, and from him to whom they entrusted much, they will demand the more.

data.prayer: Spirit, supernaturally prepare encounters with the gospel on sites like Facebook and Instagram for the 721,700 people living in Narail.
Spirit, help the church in the county of Narail do things that will multiply their numbers, not just add to them.
data.verse: But thanks be to God, who always leads us triumphantly as captives in Christ and through us spreads everywhere the fragrance of the knowledge of Him.

data.prayer: Father, 0.0% are known to be believers. Please, Lord call more today.
Father, help the 904 believers in Narail to be spiritually intentional with their relationships among their 720,796 lost friends and neighbors.
Lord, please give apostles to expand the church into every neighborhood of Narail, Khulna, Bangladesh.
data.verse: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you.

data.prayer: Father, help the 904 believers in Narail to know your commands and to do them.
data.verse: For Ezra had devoted himself to the study and observance of the Law of the Lord, and to teaching its decrees and laws in Israel.

location.name: Narail
location.people_groups_list: Peshakar, Mallah Dhawa (Muslim traditions), Dalu, Baha'i, Namassej (Hindu traditions)
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Peshakar (1,500), Mallah Dhawa (Muslim traditions) (18,000), Dalu (18,000), Baha'i (11,000), Namassej (Hindu traditions) (4,667,000)
